text: Good evening.

My name is George Hessler and
I'm the CEO of Magma Trading.
With me today is Craig Kravetz.

Once upon a time, Craig
and I worked for a company
called Lava Trading.
Lava was a pretty good company.

It created the first sweep
technology for equities.

We thought this company
was even bigger,
so we call it Magma Trading.
Lava was no slouch.

It ended up actually extracting
over 10% of the trading

in the United States going
through our little company
of a little over 100 people.

And we eventually sold
that company to Citigroup
for $365 million dollars.

Let me tell you a
little bit about Magma.

It's actually the Lava
Trading for blocks,
for large block trades.

It may surprise you to
know that the average trade

size on the New
York Stock Exchange

is actually under 200 shares,
if you can imagine that.

Now, that's fine for
you and me trading
on our personal accounts.

But can you imagine if you are
Vanguard or Fidelity, or State

Street, you don't trade
200 shares at a time.

You trade 200,000
shares at a time.

And to do that trade, you
have to take hours to do it,

thousands of trades
actually to take place
to capture that trade.

So Magma is the first wholesale
market for stock trading,

kind of like a
Costco for stocks,

the first block
market for equities.

And so just like on eBay,
a "buy it now" button,

instead of sitting through
an auction for four hours,
you can buy it now.

Magma-- the new market
for block trades.
